metadata.title: CVE-2022-48795 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:parisc: Fix data TLB miss in sba_unmap_sgRolf Eike Beer reported the following bug:[1274934.746891] Bad Address (null pointer deref?): Code=15 (Data TLB missfault) at addr 0000004140000018[1274934.746891] CPU: 3 PID: 5549 Comm: cmake Not tainted5.15.4-gentoo-parisc64 #4[1274934.746891] Hardware name: 9000/785/C8000[1274934.746891][1274934.746891]      YZrvWESTHLNXBCVMcbcbcbcbOGFRQPDI[1274934.746891] PSW: 00001000000001001111111000001110 Not tainted[1274934.746891] r00-03  000000ff0804fe0e 0000000040bc9bc0 00000000406760e40000004140000000[1274934.746891] r04-07  0000000040b693c0 0000004140000000 000000004a2b08b00000000000000001[1274934.746891] r08-11  0000000041f98810 0000000000000000 000000004a0a70000000000000000001[1274934.746891] r12-15  0000000040bddbc0 0000000040c0cbc0 0000000040bddbc00000000040bddbc0[1274934.746891] r16-19  0000000040bde3c0 0000000040bddbc0 0000000040bde3c00000000000000007[1274934.746891] r20-23  0000000000000006 000000004a368950 00000000000000000000000000000001[1274934.746891] r24-27  0000000000001fff 000000000800000e 000000004a1710f00000000040b693c0[1274934.746891] r28-31  0000000000000001 0000000041f988b0 0000000041f98840000000004a171118[1274934.746891] sr00-03  00000000066e5800 00000000000000000000000000000000 00000000066e5800[1274934.746891] sr04-07  0000000000000000 00000000000000000000000000000000 0000000000000000[1274934.746891][1274934.746891] IASQ: 0000000000000000 0000000000000000 IAOQ:00000000406760e8 00000000406760ec[1274934.746891]  IIR: 48780030    ISR: 0000000000000000  IOR:0000004140000018[1274934.746891]  CPU:        3   CR30: 00000040e3a9c000 CR31:ffffffffffffffff[1274934.746891]  ORIG_R28: 0000000040acdd58[1274934.746891]  IAOQ[0]: sba_unmap_sg+0xb0/0x118[1274934.746891]  IAOQ[1]: sba_unmap_sg+0xb4/0x118[1274934.746891]  RP(r2): sba_unmap_sg+0xac/0x118[1274934.746891] Backtrace:[1274934.746891]  [<00000000402740cc>] dma_unmap_sg_attrs+0x6c/0x70[1274934.746891]  [<000000004074d6bc>] scsi_dma_unmap+0x54/0x60[1274934.746891]  [<00000000407a3488>] mptscsih_io_done+0x150/0xd70[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040798600>] mpt_interrupt+0x168/0xa68[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040255a48>] __handle_irq_event_percpu+0xc8/0x278[1274934.746891]  [<0000000040255c34>] handle_irq_event_percpu+0x3c/0xd8[1274934.746891]  [<000000004025ecb4>] handle_percpu_irq+0xb4/0xf0[1274934.746891]  [<00000000402548e0>] generic_handle_irq+0x50/0x70[1274934.746891]  [<000000004019a254>] call_on_stack+0x18/0x24[1274934.746891][1274934.746891] Kernel panic - not syncing: Bad Address (null pointerderef?)The bug is caused by overrunning the sglist and incorrectly testingsg_dma_len(sglist) before nents. Normally this doesn't cause a crash,but in this case sglist crossed a page boundary. This occurs in thefollowing code:	while (sg_dma_len(sglist) && nents--) {The fix is simply to test nents first and move the decrement of nentsinto the loop.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48795` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
